newsitem.title: USA: Olympic Financial named in class-action suit.
newsitem.headline: Olympic Financial named in class-action suit.

text.p: Olympic Financial Ltd was named in a class-action lawsuit alleging violations of federal securities laws, according to the law firm of Heins Mills & Olson, which filed the suit.

The suit accused the company, including its former chief executive officer and president and the chairman of the board of directors, of making false and misleading statements and omissions about the company's loan programs, its retail repossession program and its loan loss reserves.
Olympic Financial officials were not available to comment on the lawsuit, which was filed March 4.
According to court documents filed in U.S. District Court for the District of Minnesota, the only plaintiff listed so far is Stuart Taran, an Olympic Financial shareholder.
Shares of Olympic Financial, a used car financing company, closed up 1/4 Wednesday at 10-1/8.
